18 RAD2DEG = 180.0/np.pi

20 
21 def reject_outliers(data, m=1):
22  """
23  Rejects one outlier.
24 
25  Arguments
26  ---------
27  `data`: `np.array`
28  The data
29 
30  `m`: `int`
31  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
32  reject data points.
33 
34  """
35  is_in_std = np.all(np.absolute(data - np.mean(data, axis=0))
36  < m * np.std(data, axis=0), axis=1)
37  return data[is_in_std, :]
38 
39 
40 def reject_outlier(data, m=1):
41  """
42  Rejects one outlier.
43 
44  Arguments
45  ---------
46  `data`: `np.array`
47  The data
48 
49  `m`: `int`
50  The number of standard deviations from the mean to
51  reject data points.
52  """
53  is_in_std = np.absolute(data - np.mean(data)) < m * np.std(data)
54  return data[is_in_std, :]

56 
57 class StaticPoseData():
58  """
59  Class to store static poses into a nested dictionary.
60  It is stored as in [20 poses][7 IMUs][data].
61  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.ndarray
62  The data is defined as below.
63  data = [mean x y z acceleration].
64  so the np.ndarray's dimension is (No. of collected data
65  x xyz accelerations)
66  """
67  def __init__(self, pose_names, imu_names, filepath):
68  """
69  Initialize StaticPoseData class.
70 
71  Arguments
72  ----------
73  pose_names: list[str]
74  Names of poses
75  imu_names: list[str]
76  Names of imus
77  filepath: str
78  Path to save the collected data
79  """
80  self.pose_names = pose_names
81  self.imu_names = imu_names
82  self.filepath = filepath
83  self.data = OrderedDict()
84 
85  # Create nested dictionary to store data
86  for pose_name in pose_names:
87  self.data[pose_name] = OrderedDict()
88  for imu_name in imu_names:
89  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.empty((0, 10), float)
90 
91  def append(self, pose_name, imu_name, data):
92  """
93  Append data to a dictionary whose keys are
94  [pose_name][imu_name]
95 
96  Arguments
97  ----------
98  pose_name: str
99  Names of poses
100  imu_name: str
101  Names of imus
102  data: np.array
103  Numpy array of size (1,3).
104  Includes an accelerometer measurement.
105  """
106  self.data[pose_name][imu_name] = \
107  np.append(self.data[pose_name][imu_name], np.array([data]), axis=0)
108 
109  def clean_data(self, verbose=False):
110  """
111  Cleans the data
112 
113  Arguments
114  ---------
115  `verbose`: `bool`
116  """
117  # Create nested dictionary to store data
118  data = copy.deepcopy(self.data)
119  for pose_name in self.pose_names:
120  for imu_name in self.imu_names:
121  d = reject_outliers(self.data[pose_name][imu_name][:, :3])
122  m = np.mean(d, axis=0)
123  # s = np.std(d, axis=0)
124  joints = reject_outliers(self.data[pose_name][imu_name][:, 3:])
125  j = np.mean(joints, axis=0)
126  data[pose_name][imu_name] = np.r_[m, j]
127 
128  if verbose:
129  rospy.loginfo('[%s, %s] Mean Acceleration: \
130  (%.3f %.3f %.3f)' % (pose_name, imu_name,
131  m[0], m[1], m[2]))
132 
133  return data
134 
135  def save(self, data):
136  """
137  Save both the original collected data and the averaged data
138 
139  Arguments
140  ---------
141  `data`: `OrderedDict`
142  The data from static data collection, saved to a pickle file.
143  """
144  ros_robotic_skin_path = rospkg.RosPack().get_path('ros_robotic_skin')
145  filepath = os.path.join(ros_robotic_skin_path, self.filepath+'.pickle')
146 
147  with open(filepath, 'wb') as f:
148  pickle.dump(data, f)
149 
150 
151 class StaticPoseDataSaver():
152  """
153  Class for collecting static pose data nd save them as a pickle file
154  """
155  def __init__(self, controller, poses_list, filepath='data/static_data'):
156  """
157  Initializes StaticPoseDataSaver class.
158 
159  Arguments
160  -----------
161  controller:
162  Wrapped controller to control either Panda or Sawyer robot.
163  poses_list: list
164  A list of poses. Each pose is a list.
165  It includes 7 joint positiosn, 7 joint velociites,
166  and the Pose name
167  filepath: str
168  File path to save the collected data
169  """
170  self.controller = controller
171  self.poses_list = poses_list
172 
173  self.pose_names = [pose[2] for pose in poses_list]
174  self.joint_names = self.controller.joint_names
175  self.imu_names = ['imu_link0', 'imu_link1', 'imu_link2',
176  'imu_link3', 'imu_link4', 'imu_link5', 'imu_link6']
177  self.imu_topics = ['imu_data0', 'imu_data1', 'imu_data2',
178  'imu_data3', 'imu_data4', 'imu_data5', 'imu_data6']
179  self.curr_pose_name = self.pose_names[0]
180  self.ready = False
181 
182  # data storage
183  self.data_storage = StaticPoseData(self.pose_names,
184  self.imu_names, filepath)
185 
186  # Subscribe to IMUs
187  for imu_topic in self.imu_topics:
188  rospy.Subscriber(imu_topic, Imu, self.callback)
189 
190  def callback(self, data):
191  """
192  A callback function for IMU topics
193 
194  Arguments
195  ----------
196  data: sensor_msgs.msg.Imu
197  IMU data. Please refer to the official documentation.
198  http://docs.ros.org/melodic/api/sensor_msgs/html/msg/Imu.html
199  """
200  if self.ready:
201  accel = data.linear_acceleration
202  joint_angles = [self.controller.joint_angle(name)
203  for name in self.joint_names]
204 
205  self.data_storage.append(
206  self.curr_pose_name, # for each defined initial pose
207  data.header.frame_id, # for each imu
208  np.array([accel.x, accel.y, accel.z] + joint_angles))
209 
210  def set_poses(self, time=3.0):
211  """
212  Move to the defined poses and collect the IMU data
213  for a given amount of time.
214 
215  time: float
216  Time to collect the IMU data
217  """
218  for pose in self.poses_list:
219  positions, _, pose_name = pose[0], pose[1], pose[2] # noqa: F841
220  self.controller.publish_positions(positions, 0.1)
221  print('At Position: ' + pose_name,
222  map(int, RAD2DEG*np.array(positions)))
223  self.curr_pose_name = pose_name
224  rospy.sleep(0.5)
225  self.ready = True
226  rospy.sleep(time)
227  self.ready = False
228 
229  def save(self, save=True, verbose=False):
230  """
231  Save data to a pickle file.
232  """
233  data = self.data_storage.clean_data(verbose)
234 
235  if save:
236  self.data_storage.save(data)
237 
238
